member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxNRMXExtension
member.summary: Provides extension methods to create NR signal configuration. These methods are added to RFmxInstrMX class.
member.remarks: For more information about NI-RFmx Instruments, refer to the NI-RFmx Instruments Help.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxNRMXExtension.GetNRSignalConfiguration(NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxInstrMX)
member.summary: Creates a new default NR signal configuration if it doesn't exist; otherwise, it returns the existing default NR signal configuration.
member.param: Specifies an instr session.
member.returns: Returns an object of type RFmxNRMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxNRMXExtension.GetNRSignalConfiguration(NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxInstrMX,System.String)
member.summary: Creates a NR signal configuration for specified signal name. Existing NR signal configuration is returned if specified signal name exists.
member.param: Specifies an RFmxInstr session.
Specifies a signal name.
member.returns: Returns an object of type RFmxNRMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxNRMXExtension.NRClearNoiseCalibrationDatabase(NationalInstruments.RFmx.InstrMX.RFmxInstrMX,System.String)
member.summary: Clears the noise calibration database used for noise compensation.
member.param: Specifies an RFmxInstr session.
Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX
member.summary: Defines a root class which is used to identify and control NR signal configuration.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.BuildOffsetString(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates the offset string.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the offset number for building the selector string.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.summary: Creates the bandwidth part string.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the bandwidth part number for building the selector string.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.SendSoftwareEdgeTrigger
member.summary:
Sends a trigger to the device when you use the RFmxNR_CfgTrigger method to choose a software version of a trigger and the device is waiting for the trigger to be sent. You can also use this method to override a hardware trigger.
This method returns an error in the following situations:
You configure an invalid trigger.
You have not previously called the method.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.GetCenterFrequency(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. For intraband carrier aggregation, this method specifies the reference frequency of a subblock. Depending on the Subblock Frequency Definition method, the center frequency can either be absolute or relative to first subblock's center frequency. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency.
member.param:
Specifies the subblock number.
Example: "subblock0".
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Upon return, contains the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. For intraband carrier aggregation, this method specifies the reference frequency of a subblock. Depending on the Subblock Frequency Definition method, the center frequency can either be absolute or relative to first subblock's center frequency. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.The default of this property is hardware dependent.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.SetCenterFrequency(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. For intraband carrier aggregation, this method specifies the reference frequency of a subblock. Depending on the Subblock Frequency Definition method, the center frequency can either be absolute or relative to first subblock's center frequency. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency.
member.param:
Specifies the subblock number.
Example: "subblock0".
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. For intraband carrier aggregation, this method specifies the reference frequency of a subblock. Depending on the Subblock Frequency Definition method, the center frequency can either be absolute or relative to first subblock's center frequency. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method sets the value of attribute.The default of this property is hardware dependent.

member.summary: Gets the power level at which the device triggers. This value is expressed in dB when you set the method to ; and in dBm when you set the IQ Power Edge Level Type method to . This method is used only when you set the method to .

member.summary: Gets the index of the component carrier having its center at the user-configured center frequency. The measurement uses this method along with method to calculate the value of the . This method is ignored if you set the CC Spacing Type method to .

Upon return, contains the index of the component carrier having its center at the user-configured center frequency. The measurement uses this method along with method to calculate the value of the . This method is ignored if you set the CC Spacing Type method to .
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.Valid values are -1, 0, 1 ... n - 1, inclusive, where n is the number of component carriers in the subblock. The default value is -1. If the value is -1, the component carrier frequency values are calculated such that the center of the subcarrier(with maximum subcarrier spacing for a frequency range), which is closest to the center of the aggregated channel bandwidth, lies at the center frequency.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.ConfigureRF(System.String,System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Configures the RF methods of the signal specified by the selector string.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Specifies the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. The parameter specifies the reference frequency of the subblock for intra-band carrier aggregation. Depending on the method, the center frequency can either be an absolute frequency or relative to the absolute frequency of the center frequency of the first subblock. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency. The default value of this parameter is hardware dependent.

Specifies the reference level which represents the maximum expected power of the RF input signal. This value is expressed in dBm for RF devices and Vpk-pk for baseband devices. The default value of this parameter is hardware dependent.

Specifies the attenuation of a switch or cable connected to the RF IN connector of the signal analyzer. This value is expressed in dB. For more information about attenuation, refer to the RF Attenuation and Signal Levels topic for your device in the NI RF Vector Signal Analyzers Help.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to configure this method.

"subblock0"

Specifies the center frequency of the acquired RF signal for a single carrier. This value is expressed in Hz. The parameter specifies the reference frequency of the subblock for intra-band carrier aggregation. Depending on the method, the center frequency can either be an absolute frequency or relative to the absolute frequency of the center frequency of the first subblock. All component carrier frequencies within the subblock are defined with respect to this frequency. The default value of this parameter is hardware dependent.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.AnalyzeIQ1Waveform(System.String,System.String,NationalInstruments.ComplexWaveform{NationalInstruments.ComplexSingle},System.Boolean,System.Int64)
member.summary:
Performs the enabled measurements on the I/Q complex waveform that you specify in IQ parameter. Call this method after you configure the signal and measurement methods. You can fetch measurement results using the Fetch methods or result methods in the method node. Use this method only if the Recommended Acquisition Type method value is either IQ or IQorSpectral.
When using the Analysis-Only mode in RFmxNR, the RFmx driver ignores the RFmx hardware settings such as reference level and attenuation. The only RF hardware settings that are not ignored are the center frequency and trigger type, since it is needed for spectral measurement traces as well as some measurements such as ModAcc, ACP, and SEM.
Query the Recommended Acquisition Type method from the RFmxInstr Property Node after calling the RFmxNR Commit method.
member.param:
Specifies the result name. The result name can either be specified through this input or the resultName parameter. If you do not specify the result name in this parameter, either the result name specified by the resultName parameter or the default result instance is used. Example:
""
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the name to be associated with measurement results. Provide a unique name, such as "r1" to enable fetching of multiple measurement results and traces. This input accepts the result name with or without the "result::" prefix. Example:
"result::r1"
"r1"
Specifies the data for a complex waveform including the start, delta, and actual values.
Resets measurement averaging. If you enable averaging, set this parameter to TRUE for first record and FALSE for subsequent records.
Reserved.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMX.AutoLevel(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Examines the input signal to calculate the peak power level and sets it as the value of the method. Use this method to calculate an approximate setting for the reference level.
The RFmxNR Auto Level method completes the following tasks:
Resets the mixer level, mixer level offset, and IF output power offset.
Sets the starting reference level to the maximum reference level supported by the device based on the current RF attenuation, mechanical attenuation, and preamplifier enabled settings.
Iterates to adjust the reference level based on the input signal peak power.
Uses immediate triggering and restores the trigger settings back to user setting after the execution.
When using NI-PXIe 5663, NI-PXIe 5665, or NI-PXIe 5668R device, NI recommends that you set an appropriate value for mechanical attenuation before calling the RFmxNR Auto Level method. Setting an appropriate value for mechanical attenuation reduces the number of times the attenuator settings are changed by this method; thus reducing wear and tear, and maximizing the life time of the attenuator.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Specifies the acquisition length. This value is expressed in seconds. Use this value to compute the number of samples to acquire from the signal analyzer. Auto Level method does not use any trigger for acquisition. It ignores the user-configured trigger methods. NI recommends that you set a sufficiently high measurement interval to ensure that the acquired waveform is at least as long as one period of the signal.
Upon return, contains the estimated peak power level of the input signal. This value is expressed in dBm. The default value of this parameter is hardware dependent.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.summary: Configures the device to wait for the complex power of the I/Q data to cross the specified threshold to mark a reference point within the record.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.
Specifies the channel from which the device monitors the trigger.

Specifies whether the device asserts the trigger when the signal power is rising or when it is falling. The device asserts the trigger when the signal power exceeds the specified level with the slope you specify.

Specifies the power level at which the device triggers, depending on the value of the iqPowerEdgeTriggerSlope parameter. The value is expressed in dB when the iqPowerEdgeTriggerLevelType parameter is set to , or in dBm when it is set to .
Specifies the trigger delay time. This value is expressed in seconds.
Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum quiet time used for triggering.

Specifies the duration for which the signal must be quiet before the signal analyzer arms the I/Q power edge trigger. This value is expressed in seconds. If you set to , the signal is quiet when it is below the trigger level.
Specifies whether the IQPowerEdgeLevel is set to or . The value is expressed in dB when this parameter is set to . The value is expressed in dBm when this parameter is set to .
Specifies whether the trigger is used.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.summary: Represents the ACP measurement.

member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to configure the ACP measurement.

member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the ACP measurement results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType
member.summary: Specifies whether the amplitude of the frequency bins, used in measurements, is corrected for external attenuation at the RF center frequency, or at the individual frequency bins. Use the RFmxInstr_CfgExternalAttenuationTable function to configure the external attenuation table.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType.RFCenterFrequency
member.summary: All the frequency bins in the spectrum are compensated with a single external attenuation value that corresponds to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAmplitudeCorrectionType.SpectrumFrequencyBin
member.summary: An individual frequency bin in the spectrum is compensated with the external attenuation value corresponding to that frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the ACP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The ACP measurement uses the value of the method as the number of acquisitions over which the ACP measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for ACP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations, but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithmic scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The lowest power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.summary: Gets the integration bandwidth of the component carrier (CC). This value is expressed in Hz.
member.param:
Specifies the carrier number and subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0" or
"subblock0/carrier0".
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Upon return, contains the integration bandwidth of the component carrier (CC). This value is expressed in Hz.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.The default value is 9 MHz.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpComponentCarrierResults.FetchMeasurementArray(System.String,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Returns an array of the absolute and relative powers measured in the component carriers.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains an array of the power measured over the integration bandwidth of the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains an array of the component carrier power relative to its subblock power. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpComponentCarrierResults.FetchMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Returns the absolute and relative powers measured in the component carriers.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the power measured over the integration bandwidth of the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains the component carrier power relative to its subblock power. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpConfiguration.ConfigureNumberOfUtraOffsets(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures the number of UTRA adjacent channels of the subblock.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to configure this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftOverlapMode.Automatic

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.None
member.summary: No spectral leakage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.FlatTop
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using flat top window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.Hanning
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using Hanning window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.Hamming
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using Hamming window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.Gaussian
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using Gaussian window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.Blackman
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using Blackman window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.BlackmanHarris
member.summary: Spectral leakage is reduced using Blackman-Harris window type.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpFftWindow.KaiserBessel

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes an appropriate IF output power level offset for the offset channels to improve the dynamic range of the ACP measurement. This method is applicable only when you set the method to .

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement sets the IF output power level offset using the values of the ACP Near IF Output Pwr Offset (dB) and ACP Far IF Output Pwr Offset (dB) properties.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpIFOutputPowerOffsetAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement automatically computes an IF output power level offset for the offset channels to improve the dynamic range of the ACP measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMethod
member.summary: Specifies the method for performing the ACP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMethod.Normal
member.summary: The ACP measurement acquires the spectrum using the same signal analyzer setting across frequency bands. Use this method when measurement speed is desirable over higher dynamic range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMethod.DynamicRange
member.summary: The ACP measurement acquires the spectrum using the hardware-specific optimizations for different frequency bands. Use this method to get the best dynamic range. Supported Devices: PXIe 5665/5668R

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMethod.SequentialFft
member.summary: The ACP measurement acquires all the samples specified by the method and divides them in to smaller chunks of equal size defined by the method. FFT is computed for each chunk. The resultant FFTs are averaged to get the spectrum used to compute the ACP. If the total acquired samples is not an integer multiple of the FFT size, the remaining samples at the end of the acquisition are not used. Use this method to optimize for speed. The accuracy of results may be reduced when using this measurement method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement calibrates the noise floor of analyzer or performs the ACP measurement. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMode.Measure
member.summary: Performs the ACP measurement on the acquired signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpMeasurementMode.CalibrateNoiseFloor
member.summary: Performs manual noise calibration of the signal analyzer for the ACP measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether RFmx automatically computes the averaging count used for instrument noise calibration.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto.False
member.summary: RFmx uses the averaging count that you set for the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto.True
member.summary: When you set the method to , RFmx uses a noise calibration averaging count of 32. When you set the ACP Meas Method method to and the sweep time is less than 5 ms, RFmx uses a noise calibration averaging count of 15. When you set the ACP Meas Method to and the sweep time is greater than or equal to 5 ms, RFmx uses a noise calibration averaging count of 5.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationDataValid
member.summary: Indicates whether calibration data is valid for the configuration specified by the signal name in the selectorstring parameter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationDataValid.False
member.summary: Returns false if the calibration data is not present for the specified configuration or if the difference between the current device temperature and the calibration temperature exceeds the [-5 C, 5 C] range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationDataValid.True
member.summary: Returns true if the calibration data is present for the configuration specified by the signal name in the Selector string parameter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise calibration and measurement is performed manually by the user or automatically by RFmx. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationMode.Manual
member.summary: When you set the method to Noise Calibrate, you can initiate instrument noise calibration for ACP manually. When you set the ACP Meas Mode method to , you can initiate the ACP measurement manually.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCalibrationMode.Auto
member.summary: When you set the method to , RFmx sets Input Isolation Enabled method to Enabled and calibrates the instrument noise in the current state of the instrument. Next, RFmx resets the Input Isolation Enabled method and performs the ACP measurement, including compensation for the noise contribution of the instrument. RFmx skips noise calibration in this mode if valid noise calibration data is already cached.When you set the ACP Noise Comp Enabled method to , RFmx does not calibrate instrument noise and performs the ACP measurement without compensating for the noise contribution of the instrument.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether RFmx compensates for the instrument noise when performing the measurement when you set method to , or when you set ACP Noise Cal Mode to and method to Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: Disables noise compensation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: Enables noise compensation.Supported Devices: PXIe-5663/5665/5668R, PXIe-5830/5831

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationType
member.summary: Specifies the noise compensation type. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationType.AnalyzerAndTermination
member.summary: Compensates for noise from the analyzer and the 50-ohm termination. The measured power values are in excess of the thermal noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpNoiseCompensationType.AnalyzerOnly
member.summary: Compensates only for analyzer noise only.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwAutoBandwidth.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the RBW that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwAutoBandwidth.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the RBW filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: An RBW filter with a Gaussian response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: An RBW filter with a flat response is applied.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcpResults.GetTotalAggregatedPower(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. This value includes the power in the inter-carrier gaps within a subblock, but it does not include the power within the subblock gaps.
member.param:
Specifies the result name.
Example: ""
"result::r1"
You can use themethod to build the selectorString.

Upon return, contains the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. This value includes the power in the inter-carrier gaps within a subblock, but it does not include the power within the subblock gaps.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcquisitionBandwidthOptimizationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether RFmx optimizes the acquisition bandwidth. This may cause acquisition center frequency or local oscillator (LO) to be placed at different position than you configured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcquisitionBandwidthOptimizationEnabled.False
member.summary: RFmx does not optimize acquisition bandwidth and will be based on the Nyquist criterion. The value of the acquisition center frequency is the same as the value of the Center Frequency that you configure.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAcquisitionBandwidthOptimizationEnabled.True
member.summary: RFmx positions the acquisition center frequency to acquire the least bandwidth based on the configuration and span needed for the measurement. This helps in reducing the amount of data to process for the measurement, thus improving the speed. However this might cause the LO to be positioned at a non-dc subcarrier position, hence the measurement sensitive to it should have this method disabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoIncrementCellIDEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the cell ID of component carrier is auto calculated and configured by the measurement or configured by the user.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoIncrementCellIDEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the user-configured cell IDs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoIncrementCellIDEnabled.True
member.summary: The Cell ID of each CC is auto calculated as specified in section 4.9.2.3 of 3GPP 38.141 specification.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoResourceBlockDetectionEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether the values of modulation type, number of resource block clusters, resource block offsets, and number of resource blocks are auto-detected by the measurement or configured by you.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoResourceBlockDetectionEnabled.False
member.summary: The values of modulation type, number of resource block clusters, resource block offsets, and number of resource blocks that you specify are used for the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXAutoResourceBlockDetectionEnabled.True
member.summary: The values of modulation type, number of resource block clusters, resource block offsets, and number of resource blocks are auto-detected by the measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXBandwidthPartCyclicPrefixMode
member.summary: Specifies the cyclic prefix (CP) duration and the number of symbols in a slot for the signal being measured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXBandwidthPartCyclicPrefixMode.Normal
member.summary: The number of symbols in the slot is 14.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXBandwidthPartCyclicPrefixMode.Extended
member.summary: The number of symbols in the slot is 12.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChp
member.summary: Represents the CHP measurement.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChp.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to configure the CHP measurement.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChp.Results
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the CHP measurement results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAmplitudeCorrectionType
member.summary: Specifies whether the amplitude of frequency bins in the spectrum used by the measurement is corrected for external attenuation at RF center frequency or corrected for external attenuation at individual frequency bins Use the RFmxInstr_CfgExternalAttenuationTable function to configure the external attenuation table.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAmplitudeCorrectionType.RFCenterFrequency
member.summary: All frequency bins in the spectrum are compensated with a single external attenuation value that corresponds to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAmplitudeCorrectionType.SpectrumFrequencyBin
member.summary: Individual frequency bin in the spectrum is compensated with the external attenuation value corresponding to that frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the CHP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The CHP measurement uses the value of the method as the number of acquisitions over which the CHP measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for CHP measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithmic scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The lowest power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpComponentCarrierConfiguration.GetIntegrationBandwidth(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the integration bandwidth of a component carrier (CC). This value is expressed in Hz.
member.param:
Specifies the carrier number and subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0" or
"subblock0/carrier0".
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Upon return, contains the integration bandwidth of a component carrier (CC). This value is expressed in Hz.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.The default value is 9 MHz.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpComponentCarrierResults.FetchMeasurementArray(System.String,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Returns an arry of the absolute and relative powers measured in the component carriers.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains an array of the power measured over the integration bandwidth of the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains an array of the component carrier power relative to its subblock power. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpComponentCarrierResults.FetchMeasurement(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Returns the absolute and relative powers measured in the component carriers.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the power measured over the integration bandwidth of the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains the component carrier power relative to its subblock power. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpIntegrationBandwidthType
member.summary: Specifies the integration bandwidth (IBW) type used to measure the power of the acquired signal. Integration bandwidth is the frequency interval over which the power in each frequency bin is added to measure the total power in that interval.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpIntegrationBandwidthType.SignalBandwidth
member.summary: The IBW excludes the guard bands at the edges of the carrier or subblock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpIntegrationBandwidthType.ChannelBandwidth
member.summary: The IBW includes the guard bands at the edges of the carrier or subblock.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpMeasurementMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement calibrates the noise floor of analyzer or performs the CHP measurement. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpMeasurementMode.Measure
member.summary: Performs the CHP measurement on the acquired signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpMeasurementMode.CalibrateNoiseFloor
member.summary: Performs manual noise calibration of the signal analyzer for the CHP measurement.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether RFmx automatically computes the averaging count used for instrument noise calibration.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto.False
member.summary: RFmx uses the averages that you set for method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationAveragingAuto.True
member.summary: RFmx uses a noise calibration averaging count of 32.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationDataValid
member.summary: Indicates whether calibration data is valid for the configuration specified by the signal name in the selectorstring parameter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationDataValid.False
member.summary: Returns false if the calibration data is not present for the specified configuration or if the difference between the current device temperature and the calibration temperature exceeds the [-5 C, 5 C] range.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationDataValid.True
member.summary: Returns true if the calibration data is present for the configuration specified by the signal name in the Selector string parameter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the noise calibration and measurement is performed manually by the user or automatically by RFmx. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationMode.Manual
member.summary: When you set method to , you can initiate the instrument noise calibration for CHP manually. When you set the CHP Meas Mode method to , you can initiate the CHP measurement manually.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCalibrationMode.Auto
member.summary: When you set the method to , RFmx sets the Input Isolation Enabled method to Enabled and calibrates the instrument noise in the current state of the instrument. Next, RFmx resets the Input Isolation Enabled method and performs the CHP measurement including compensation for the noise contribution of the instrument. RFmx skips noise calibration in this mode if valid noise calibration data is already cached. When you set the CHP Noise Comp Enabled to , RFmx does not calibrate instrument noise and performs the CHP measurement without compensating for the noise contribution of the instrument.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether RFmx compensates for the instrument noise when performing the measurement. To compensate for instrument noise when performing a CHP measurement, set the method to , or set the CHP Noise Cal Mode method to and the method to . Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationEnabled.False
member.summary: Indicates that noise compensation is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationEnabled.True
member.summary: Indicates that noise compensation is enabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationType
member.summary: Specifies the noise compensation type. Refer to the measurement guidelines section in the Noise Compensation Algorithm topic for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationType.AnalyzerAndTermination
member.summary: Compensates for noise contribution of the analyzer instrument and the 50-ohm termination. The measured power values are in excess of the thermal noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpNoiseCompensationType.AnalyzerOnly
member.summary: Compensates only for analyzer noise only.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwAutoBandwidth
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwAutoBandwidth.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the RBW that you specify in the CHP RBW (Hz) method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwAutoBandwidth.True
member.summary: The measurement computes the RBW.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwFilterType
member.summary: Specifies the shape of the digital RBW filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwFilterType.FftBased
member.summary: No RBW filtering is performed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwFilterType.Gaussian
member.summary: An RBW filter with a Gaussian response is applied.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpRbwFilterType.Flat
member.summary: An RBW filter with a flat response is applied.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpResults
member.summary: Provides methods to fetch and read the CHP measurement results.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpResults.GetTotalAggregatedPower(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. This value includes the power in the inter-carrier gaps within a subblock, but it does not include the power within the subblock gaps.
member.param:
Specifies the result name.
Example: ""
"result::r1"
You can use themethod to build the selectorString.

Upon return, contains the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. This value includes the power in the inter-carrier gaps within a subblock, but it does not include the power within the subblock gaps.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpResults.GetSubblockPower(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblock. This includes the power in inter-carrier gaps within a subblock. This value is expressed in dBm.
member.param: Specifies the result name and Subblock number. Example: "Subblock0", "result::r1/Subblock0". You can use the method to build the selector string.

Upon return, contains the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblock. This includes the power in inter-carrier gaps within a subblock. This value is expressed in dBm.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXChpResults.FetchSpectrum(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@)
member.summary: Fetches the spectrum used for CHP measurements.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used.
Example:
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the spectrum.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Upon return, contains the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. member.summary:

Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.

member.summary: The IQ Power Edge Level method specifies the absolute power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope
member.summary: Specifies whether the device asserts the trigger when the signal power is rising or when it is falling. The device asserts the trigger when the signal power exceeds the specified level with the slope you specify.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope.Rising
member.summary: The trigger asserts when the signal power is rising.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXIQPowerEdgeTriggerSlope.Falling
member.summary: The trigger asserts when the signal power is falling.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange
member.summary: Specifies the set of properties that are considered by RFmx in the locked signal configuration state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.Disabled
member.summary: This is the normal mode of RFmx operation. All configuration changes in RFmxInstr properties or in personality properties will be applied during RFmx Commit.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.NoChange
member.summary: Signal configuration is locked after the first Commit of the named signal configuration. Any configuration change thereafter either in RFmxInstr properties or personality properties will not be considered by subsequent RFmx Commits or Initiates of this signal. Use No Change if you have created named signal configurations for all measurement configurations but are setting some RFmxInstr properties. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.Frequency
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than center frequency and external attenuation, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter, only the Center Frequency and method value changes will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.ReferenceLevel
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than the reference level, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter only the method value change will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. If you have configured this signal to use an IQ Power Edge Trigger, NI recommends that you set the to so that the trigger level is automatically adjusted as you adjust the reference level. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.FrequencyAndReferenceLevel
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than center frequency, reference level, and external attenuation, is locked after first Commit of the named signal configuration. Thereafter only Center Frequency, , and method value changes will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. If you have configured this signal to use an IQ Power Edge Trigger, NI recommends you set the to so that the trigger level is automatically adjusted as you adjust the reference level. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLimitedConfigurationChange.SelectedPortsFrequencyAndReferenceLevel
member.summary: Signal configuration, other than selected ports, center frequency, reference level, external attenuation, and RFInstr configuration, is locked after first Commit or Initiate of the named signal configuration. Thereafter only Selected Ports, Center Frequency, Reference Level, and External Attenuation method value changes will be considered by subsequent driver Commits or Initiates of this signal. If you have configured this signal to use an IQ Power Edge Trigger, NI recommends you set the IQ Power Edge Level Type to so that the trigger level is automatically adjusted as you adjust the reference level. Refer to the Limitations of the Limited Configuration Change Property topic for more details about the limitations of using this mode.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLinkDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction for which the frequency is calculated. Only Uplink is supported.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLinkDirection.Downlink
member.summary: NR measurement uses 3GPP NR downlink specification to measure the received signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXLinkDirection.Uplink
member.summary: The frequency is calculated in the reverse link direction, also know as the uplink direction.

member.summary: Represents the ModAcc measurement.

member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to configure the ModAcc measurement.

member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the ModAcc measurement results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Enables averaging for the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The measurement is averaged over multiple acquisitions. The number of acquisitions is obtained by the method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccChannelEstimationType
member.summary: Specifies the method used for channel estimation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccChannelEstimationType.Reference
member.summary: Only demodulation reference (DMRS) symbol is used to calculate channel coefficients.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccChannelEstimationType.ReferenceAndData
member.summary: Both demodulation reference (DMRS) and data symbols are used to calculate channel coefficients. This method is as per definition of 3GPP NR specification.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCommonClockSourceEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether same reference clock is used for local oscillator and digital-to-analog converter. When same reference clock is used the Carrier Frequency Offset is proportional to Sample Clock Error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCommonClockSourceEnabled.False
member.summary: The Sample Clock error is estimated independently.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCommonClockSourceEnabled.True
member.summary: The Sample Clock error is estimated from carrier frequency offset.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludeDmrs
member.summary: Specifies whether the DMRS resource elements are included for composite EVM and magnitude and phase error results and traces.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludeDmrs.False
member.summary: The DMRS resource elements are not included.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludeDmrs.True
member.summary: The DMRS resource elements are included.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludePtrs
member.summary: Specifies whether the PTRS resource elements are included for composite EVM and magnitude and phase error results and traces.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludePtrs.False
member.summary: The PTRS resource elements are not included.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccCompositeResultsIncludePtrs.True
member.summary: The PTRS resource elements are included.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccConfiguration.GetFftWindowOffset(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the position of the FFT window used to calculate the EVM when method is set to . The offset is expressed as a percentage of the cyclic prefix length. If you set this method to 0, the EVM window starts at the end of cyclic prefix. If you set this method to 100, the EVM window starts at the beginning of cyclic prefix.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Upon return, contains the position of the FFT window used to calculate the EVM when method is set to . The offset is expressed as a percentage of the cyclic prefix length. If you set this method to 0, the EVM window starts at the end of cyclic prefix. If you set this method to 100, the EVM window starts at the beginning of cyclic prefix.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.The default value is 50. Valid values are 0 to 100, inclusive.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccConfiguration.SetFftWindowOffset(System.String,System.Double)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccConfiguration.GetFftWindowLength(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the FFT window length (W). This value is expressed as a percentage of the cyclic prefix length. This method is used when you set the method to , where it is needed to calculate the EVM using two different FFT window positions, Delta_C-W/2, and Delta_C+W/2.
member.param: Pass an empty string. The signal name that is passed when creating the signal configuration is used.

Upon return, contains the FFT window length (W). This value is expressed as a percentage of the cyclic prefix length. This method is used when you set the method to , where it is needed to calculate the EVM using two different FFT window positions, Delta_C-W/2, and Delta_C+W/2.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
member.remarks: This method gets the value of attribute.The default value is -1. Valid values range from -1 to 100, inclusive. When this property is set to -1, the measurement automatically sets the value of this property to the recommended value as specified in the Annexe F.5 of 3GPP TS 38.101-2 specification for uplink and Annexe B.5.2 and C.5.2 of 3GPP TS 38.104 specification for downlink.

member.summary: Specifies the FFT window type used for EVM calculation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFftWindowType.Type3GPP
member.summary: The maximum EVM between the start window position and the end window position is returned according to the 3GPP specification. The FFT window positions are specified by the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFftWindowType.TypeCustom
member.summary: Only one FFT window position is used for the EVM calculation. FFT window position is specified by method.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFrequencyErrorEstimation
member.summary: Specifies the operation mode of frequency error estimation. If frequency error is absent in the signal to be analyzed, you may disable frequency estimation to reduce measurement time or to avoid measurement inaccuracy due to error in frequency error estimation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFrequencyErrorEstimation.Disabled
member.summary: Frequency error estimation and correction is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFrequencyErrorEstimation.Normal
member.summary: Estimate and correct frequency error of range +/- half subcarrier spacing.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccFrequencyErrorEstimation.Wide
member.summary: Estimate and correct frequency error of range +/- half resource block when is , or range +/- number of guard subcarrier when is .

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQImpairmentsEstimationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to estimate the IQ impairments such as IQ gain imbalance and quadrature skew. If IQ impairments is absent in the signal to be analyzed, you may disable IQ impairments estimation to reduce measurement time or to avoid measurement inaccuracy due to error in IQ impairments estimation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQImpairmentsEstimationEnabled.False
member.summary: Indicates that IQ impairments estimation is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQImpairmentsEstimationEnabled.True
member.summary: Indicates that IQ impairments estimation is enabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQOriginOffsetEstimationEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to estimate the IQ origin offset. If IQ origin offset is absent in the signal to be analyzed, you may disable IQ origin offset estimation to reduce measurement time or to avoid measurement inaccuracy due to error in IQ origin offset estimation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQOriginOffsetEstimationEnabled.False
member.summary: Indicates that IQ origin offset estimation and correction is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccIQOriginOffsetEstimationEnabled.True
member.summary: Indicates that IQ origin offset estimation and correction is enabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMagnitudeAndPhaseErrorEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to measure the magnitude and the phase error.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMagnitudeAndPhaseErrorEnabled.False
member.summary: Indicates that magnitude error and phase error results computation is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMagnitudeAndPhaseErrorEnabled.True
member.summary: Indicates that magnitude error and phase error results computation is enabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMeasurementLengthUnit
member.summary: Specifies the units in which measurement offset and measurement length are specified.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMeasurementLengthUnit.Slot
member.summary: Measurement offset and measurement length are specified in units of slots.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMeasurementLengthUnit.Subframe
member.summary: Measurement offset and measurement length are specified in units of subframes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMeasurementLengthUnit.Time
member.summary: Measurement offset and measurement length are specified in seconds. Specify the measurement offset and length in multiples of 1 ms * (15 kHz/minimum subcarrier spacing of all carriers). All slots within this notional time duration are analysed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMulticarrierFilterEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to use the filter in single carrier configurations to minimize leakage into the carrier. Measurement ignores this method, if number of carriers is set to more than 1 or if you set the method to , where in the multi carrier filter will always be used.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMulticarrierFilterEnabled.True
member.summary: Measurement filters out unwanted emissions.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccMulticarrierFilterEnabled.False
member.summary: Measurement doesn't use the filter.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccPhaseTrackingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether phase tracking is enabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccPhaseTrackingEnabled.False
member.summary: The phase tracking is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccPhaseTrackingEnabled.True
member.summary: The phase tracking is done per symbol.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults
member.summary: Provides methods to fetch and read the ModAcc measurement results.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.GetCompositeRmsEvmMean(System.String,System.Double@)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.GetSpectralFlatnessRange1MaximumToRange1Minimum(System.String,System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the peak-to-peak ripple of the magnitude of EVM equalizer coefficients within Range1 for the measurement unit, that has the worst ripple margin among all four ripple results defined in section 6.4.2.4.1 of 3GPP 38.101-1 specification and section 6.4.2.4.1 of 3GPP 38.101-2 specification. member.param:

"subblock0/carrier0"

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.FetchInBandEmissionTrace(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Single}@,NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform{System.Single}@)
member.niparametertypes: System.String,System.Double,ref NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform`1[[System.Single, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]],ref NationalInstruments.AnalogWaveform`1[[System.Single, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]
member.summary:
Fetches the in-band emission trace and limits trace for the component carrier. In-band emission is measured as the ratio of the power in non-allocated resource blocks to the power in the allocated resource blocks averaged over the measurement interval. The IBE for various regions (general, carrier leakage, and I/Q Image) are obtained and concatenated to form a composite trace and the limits are defined in section 6.4.2.3 of 3GPP 38.101-1, and section 6.4.2.3 of 3GPP 38.101-2. The trace is not returned when there is full allocation of bandwidth, or there is clustered PUSCH or there is more than one active component carrier.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the in-band emission margin.
Upon return, contains the in-band emission mask.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.FetchSubblockInBandEmissionTrace(System.String,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Returns the in-band emission trace and limit trace for the the subblocks aggregated bandwidth. In-band emission is measured as the ratio of the power in non-allocated resource blocks to the power in the allocated resource blocks averaged over the measurement interval. The IBE for various regions (general, carrier leakage, and I/Q Image) are obtained and concatenated to form a composite trace and the limits are defined in section 6.4.2.3 of 3GPP 38.101-1, and section 6.4.2.3 of 3GPP 38.101-2. The trace is not returned when there is full allocation of bandwidth, or there is clustered PUSCH or there is more than one active component carrier.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the array of subblock in-band emission measurement trace.
Upon return, contains the array of subblock in-band emission mask trace.
Upon return, contains the array of resource block indices for the subblock in-band emission trace. It can have non integer values depending upon the spacing between carriers.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.FetchSpectralFlatnessTrace(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@,NationalInstruments.Spectrum{System.Single}@)
member.niparametertypes: System.String,System.Double,ref NationalInstruments.Spectrum`1[[System.Single, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]],ref NationalInstruments.Spectrum`1[[System.Single, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]],ref NationalInstruments.Spectrum`1[[System.Single, mscorlib, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b77a5c561934e089]]
member.summary:
Returns the spectral flatness, upper mask, and lower mask traces. Spectral flatness is the magnitude of equalizer coefficients at each allocated subcarrier. Lower and upper masks are derived from section 6.5.2.4.5 of 3GPP TS 38.521-1 specification.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the spectral flatness.
Upon return, contains the lower mask of the spectral flatness.
Upon return, contains the upper mask of the spectral flatness.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXModAccResults.FetchCompositeEvm(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@,System.Double@)
member.summary:
Fetches the composite EVM for ModAcc measurements.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Upon return, contains the mean value of the RMS EVMs calculated on all configured channels over the slots specified by the method. When you set the method to , the measurement returns this result as a percentage.When you set the method to , the measurement returns this result in dB.
Upon return, contains the symbol index where the ModAcc maximum peak composite EVM occurs.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Upon return, contains the RMS EVM of each subcarrier averaged across all the OFDM symbols allocated with PSS within the measurement length. The unit of this EVM value is specified by the ModAccEvmUnit.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.
