member.summary:
Fetches PVT ON and OFF powers along with measurement status and burst width.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to read from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, and carrier number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
"result::r1/subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the timeout for which the method waits for the measurement to complete. This value is expressed in seconds. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains the measurement status indicating whether the off power before and after is within the standard defined limit.
Upon return, contains the OFF power in the segment before the captured burst. The segment is defined as one slot prior to a short transient segment and the burst. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains the OFF power in the segment after the captured burst. The segment is defined as one slot after the burst and a short transient segment. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains the power of the subframes within the captured burst. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains the width of the captured burst. This value is expressed in seconds.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXReferenceGridAlignmentMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to align the bandwidthparts and the SSB in a component carrier to a reference resource grid automatically or manually.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXReferenceGridAlignmentMode.Manual
member.summary: The subcarrier spacing of the reference resource grid and the grid start of each bandwidthpart is user specified. Center of subcarrier 0 in common resource block 0 of the reference resource grid is considered as Reference Point A.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXReferenceGridAlignmentMode.Auto
member.summary: The subcarrier spacing of the reference resource grid is determined by the largest subcarrier spacing among the configured bandwidthparts and the SSB. The grid start of each bandwidthpart and the SSB is computed by minimizing k0 to {0, +6} subcarriers.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType
member.summary: Returns the modulation of the shared channel user data if you set the method to ; otherwise, returns the configured modulation of the shared user data. In case of downlink test model, the modulation type specified by the 3GPP standard is returned.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.PiBy2_Bpsk
member.summary: Specifies the PI/2 BPSK modulation scheme.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.Qpsk
member.summary: Specifies the QPSK modulation scheme.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.Qam16
member.summary: Specifies the 16 QAM modulation scheme.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.Qam64
member.summary: Specifies the 64 QAM modulation scheme.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.Qam256
member.summary: Specifies the 256 QAM modulation scheme.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSchDetectedModulationType.Qam1024
member.summary: Specifies a 1024 QAM modulation scheme.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSem
member.summary: Represents the SEM measurement.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSem.Configuration
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to configure the SEM measurement.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSem.Results
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the SEM measurement results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType
member.summary: Specifies whether the amplitude of the frequency bins, used in measurements, is corrected for external attenuation at the RF center frequency, or at the individual frequency bins. Use the RFmxInstr_CfgExternalAttenuationTable function to configure the external attenuation table.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType.RFCenterFrequency
member.summary: All the frequency bins in the spectrum are compensated with a single external attenuation value that corresponds to the RF center frequency.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAmplitudeCorrectionType.SpectrumFrequencyBin
member.summary: An individual frequency bin in the spectrum is compensated with the external attenuation value corresponding to that frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether to enable averaging for the SEM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingEnabled.False
member.summary: The measurement is performed on a single acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingEnabled.True
member.summary: The SEM measurement uses the value of the method as the number of acquisitions over which the SEM measurement is averaged.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType
member.summary: Specifies the averaging type for averaging multiple spectrum acquisitions. The averaged spectrum is used for SEM measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType.Rms
member.summary: The power spectrum is linearly averaged. RMS averaging reduces signal fluctuations but not the noise floor.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType.Log
member.summary: The power spectrum is averaged in a logarithmic scale.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType.Scalar
member.summary: The square root of the power spectrum is averaged.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType.Maximum
member.summary: The peak power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemAveragingType.Minimum
member.summary: The lowest power in the spectrum at each frequency bin is retained from one acquisition to the next.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemComponentCarrierConfiguration.ConfigureRatedOutputPower(System.String,System.Double)
member.summary:
Configures the rated output power (Prated, x) of the component carrier.
Use "carrier(k)" or "subblock(n)/carrier(k)" as the selector string to configure this method.
This method is valid when you set the Link Direction method to Downlink, SEM DL Mask Type method to Standard, and gNodeB Category method to Medium Range Base Station. For more details please refer to section 6.6.4 of 3GPP 38.104 specification.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the signal name, subblock number and carrier number.
Example:
"subblock0/carrier0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the rated output power (Prated, x), which is used only to choose the limit table for medium range base station. This value is expressed in dBm. This parameter will be considered when you set the method to , method to , and method to . For more details please refer to section 6.6.4 of 3GPP 38.104 specification.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemComponentCarrierResults.FetchMeasurementArray(System.String,System.Double,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Returns an array of the absolute and relative powers measured in the component carriers.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains an array of the power measured over the integration bandwidth of the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains an array of the peak power in the component carrier. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains an array of the frequency at which peak power occurs in the component carrier. This value is expressed in Hz.
Upon return, contains an array of the component carrier power relative to its subblock power. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureOffsetFrequencyArray(System.String,System.Double[],System.Double[],NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemOffsetSideband[])
member.summary:
Configures an array of the start and stop frequencies and the sideband of an offset segment.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to configure or read this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies an array of the start frequencies of an offset segment relative to the component carrier bandwidth edge (single carrier) or subblock aggregated channel bandwidth edge (multi-carrier). This value is expressed in Hz.

Specifies an array of the stop frequencies of an offset segment relative to the component carrier bandwidth edge (single carrier) or subblock aggregated channel bandwidth edge (multi-carrier). This value is expressed in Hz.
Specifies an array of whether the offset segment is present either on one side or on both sides of a carrier.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureOffsetRbwFilterArray(System.String,System.Double[],NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemOffsetRbwFilterType[])
member.summary:
Configures the offset RBW and the offset RBW filter type array.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to configure this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies an array of the bandwidth of an RBW filter used to sweep an acquired offset segment. This value is expressed in Hz.
Specifies an array of the shape of the digital RBW filter.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureOffsetBandwidthIntegralArray(System.String,System.Int32[])
member.summary:
Configures an array of the bandwidth integral of the offset segments.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to configure or read this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the subblock number.
Example:
"subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies an array of the resolution of a spectrum to compare with the spectral mask limits as an integer multiple of the RBW. When you set this parameter to a value greater than 1, the measurement acquires the spectrum with a narrow resolution and then processes it digitally to get a wider resolution that is equal to the product of a bandwidth integral and a RBW.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Specifies an array of the absolute power limit corresponding to the end of an offset segment. This value is expressed in dBm.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemConfiguration.ConfigureOffsetBandwidthIntegral(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary:
Configures the bandwidth integral of the offset segments.
Use "offset(k)" or "subblock(n)" or "subblock(n)/offset(k)" as the selector string to configure or read this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, subblock number, carrier number, and offset number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0/offset0"
"result::r1/subblock0/offset0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the resolution of a spectrum to compare with the spectral mask limits as an integer multiple of the RBW. When you set this parameter to a value greater than 1, the measurement acquires the spectrum with a narrow resolution and then processes it digitally to get a wider resolution that is equal to the product of a bandwidth integral and a RBW.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

You can use the method to build the selector string.
Specifies the absolute power limit corresponding to the beginning of an offset segment. This value is expressed in dBm.
Specifies the absolute power limit corresponding to the end of an offset segment. This value is expressed in dBm.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemResults.FetchLowerOffsetMarginArray(System.String,System.Double,NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemLowerOffsetMeasurementStatus[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@,System.Double[]@)
member.summary:
Returns an array of measurement status, margin, frequency at margin, absolute, and relative power at margin for lower offset segments. The relative power is relative to the total aggregated power.
Use "subblock(n)" as the selector string to read results from this method.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name, and subblock number. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used. Example:
"subblock0"
"result::r1/subblock0"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.
Upon return, contains an array of the measurement status indicating whether the power before and after the burst is within the standard defined limit.

Upon return, contains an array of the margin from the absolute limit mask for lower (negative) offset. Margin is defined as the minimum difference between the spectrum and the limit mask. This value is expressed in dB.
Upon return, contains an array of the frequency at which the margin occurs in the lower offset. This value is expressed in Hz.
Upon return, contains an array of the power at which the margin occurs in the lower offset segment. This value is expressed in dBm.
Upon return, contains an array of the power at which the margin occurs in the lower offset segment. This value is expressed in dB.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Example:
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemResults.FetchTotalAggregatedPower(System.String,System.Double,System.Double@)
member.summary: Returns the sum of powers in all the subblocks.
member.param:
Specifies a selector string comprising of the result name. If you do not specify the result name, the default result instance is used.
Example:
""
"result::r1"
You can use the method to build the selector string.

Specifies the timeout for fetching the specified measurement. This value is expressed in seconds. Set this value to an appropriate time, longer than expected for fetching the measurement. A value of -1 specifies that the method waits until the measurement is complete.

Upon return, contains the total power of all the subblocks. This value is expressed in dBm. The power in each subblock is the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblocks. This value includes the power in the inter-carrier gaps within a subblock, but it does not include the power within the subblock gaps.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Upon return, contains the measurement status indicating whether the power before and after the burst is within the standard defined limit.
member.returns: Returns the status code of this method. The status code either indicates success or describes a warning condition.

Upon return, contains the sum of powers of all the frequency bins over the integration bandwidth of the subblock. This includes the power in inter-carrier gaps within a subblock. This value is expressed in dBm.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemResults.ComponentCarrier
member.summary: Gets the instance that provides methods to fetch and read the SEM Component Carrier results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemSweepTimeAuto
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement sets the sweep time.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemSweepTimeAuto.False
member.summary: The measurement uses the sweep time that you specify in the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemSweepTimeAuto.True
member.summary: The measurement uses a sweep time of 1 ms.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType
member.summary: Specifies the spectrum emission mask used in the measurement for uplink. You must set the mask type to to configure the custom offset masks. Refer to section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP 38.101 specification for more information about standard-defined mask types.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.General
member.summary: The measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM as defined in Table 6.5.2.2-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification, Table 6.5.2.1-1 and Table 6.5A.2.1-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-2 specification, and Table 6.5B.2.1.1-1 in section 6.5B of the 3GPP TS 38.101-3 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.NS35
member.summary: The measurement selects offset frequencies and limits for the SEM as defined in Table 6.5.2.3.1-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification and Table 6.5B.2.1.2.1-1 in section 6.5B of the 3GPP TS 38.101-3 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.Custom
member.summary: You need to configure the , , , , , , , , and properties for each offset.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.NS03
member.summary: The measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.5.2.3.3-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification. In case of non-contiguous EN-DC consisting of at least one subblock with all E-UTRA carriers, for that E-UTRA subblock, the measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.6.2.2.5.1-1 and 6.6.2.2.5.1-2 in section 6.6.2 of the 3GPP TS 36.521-1 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.NS04
member.summary: The measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM as defined in Table 6.5.2.3.2-3 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification. Subcarrier spacing can be configured through method. Subcarrier spacing corresponding to first bandwidth part is used for computing mask. Transform precoding can be configured through method. Transform precoding corresponding to first bandwidth part is used for computing mask. In case of non-contiguous EN-DC consisting of at least one subblock with all E-UTRA carriers, for that E-UTRA subblock, the measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.6.2.2.3.2-3 in section 6.6.2 of the 3GPP TS 36.521-1 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.NS06
member.summary: The measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.5.2.3.4-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification In case of non-contiguous EN-DC consisting of at least one subblock with all E-UTRA carriers, for that E-UTRA subblock, the measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.6.2.2.5.3-1 and 6.6.2.2.5.3-2 in section 6.6.2 of the 3GPP TS 36.521-1 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUplinkMaskType.NS21
member.summary: The measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.5.2.3.3-1 in section 6.5.2 of the 3GPP TS 38.101-1 specification. In case of non-contiguous EN-DC consisting of at least one subblock with all E-UTRA carriers, for that E-UTRA subblock, the measurement selects the offset frequencies and limits for the SEM, as defined in Table 6.6.2.2.5.1-1 and 6.6.2.2.5.1-2 in section 6.6.2 of the 3GPP TS 36.521-1 specification.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUpperOffsetMeasurementStatus
member.summary: Returns the measurement status based on the user-configured standard measurement limits. Spectrum emission limits can be defined by setting method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUpperOffsetMeasurementStatus.Fail
member.summary: Indicates that the measurement has failed.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSemUpperOffsetMeasurementStatus.Pass
member.summary: Indicates that the measurement has passed.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbEnabled
member.summary: Specifies whether synchronization signal block (SSB) is present in the transmitted signal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbEnabled.False
member.summary: Detection of SSB in the transmitted signal is disabled.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbEnabled.True
member.summary: Detection of SSB in the transmitted signal is enabled.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern
member.summary: Specifies the candidate SS/PBCH blocks with different subcarrier spacing configurations as defined in the section 4.1 of 3GPP TS 38.213 specification.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseAUpTo3GHz
member.summary: Use with 15 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {2, 8} + 14 * n, where n is 0 or 1.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseA3GHzTo6GHz
member.summary: Use with 15 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {2, 8} + 14 * n, where n is 0, 1, 2, or 3.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseBUpTo3GHz
member.summary: Use with 30 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {4, 8, 16, 20} + 28 * n, where n is 0.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseB3GHzTo6GHz
member.summary: Use with 30 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {4, 8, 16, 20} + 28 * n, where n is 0, 1, 2, or 3.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseCUpTo3GHz
member.summary: Use with 30 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {2, 8} + 14 * n, where n is 0 or 1.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseC3GHzTo6GHz
member.summary: Use with 30 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes of {2, 8} + 14 * n, where n is 0, 1, 2, or 3.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseD
member.summary: Use with 120 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes {4, 8, 16, 20} + 28 * n. For carrier frequencies higher than 6 GHz, n is 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, 8, 10, 11, 12, 13, 15, 16, 17, or 18.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSsbPattern.CaseE
member.summary: Use with 240 kHz subcarrier spacing. The first symbols of the candidate SS/PBCH blocks have indexes {8, 12, 16, 20, 32, 36, 40, 44} + 56 * n. For carrier frequencies higher than 6 GHz, n is 0, 1, 2, 3, 5, 6, 7, or 8.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSubblockFrequencyDefinition
member.summary: Specifies if the subblock center frequency definition is an absolute frequency or relative to the absolute frequency of the first subblock. This method is ignored for the first subblock and is considered to be absolute by the measurement.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSubblockFrequencyDefinition.Relative
member.summary: Subblock center frequency is relative to the center frequency of the first subblock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSubblockFrequencyDefinition.Absolute
member.summary: Subblock center frequency is an absolute frequency.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXSubObject
member.summary: Represents members that are common to all sub-object of RFmxNRMX classes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTransmitterArchitecture
member.summary: Specifies the RF architecture at the transmitter in case of a multi-carrier. Each component carriers within a subblock can have separate LO or one common LO for entire subblock.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTransmitterArchitecture.LOPerComponentCarrier
member.summary: IQ impairments and In-band emission are calculated per component carrier.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTransmitterArchitecture.LOPerSubblock
member.summary: Additional subblock based results such as Subblock IQ Offset and Subblock In band emission are calculated apart from per carrier results.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerMinimumQuietTimeMode
member.summary: Specifies whether the measurement computes the minimum quiet time used for triggering.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerMinimumQuietTimeMode.Manual
member.summary: The minimum quiet time for triggering is the value of the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerMinimumQuietTimeMode.Auto
member.summary: The measurement computes the minimum quiet time used for triggering.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerType
member.summary: Specifies the type of trigger to be used for signal acquisition.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerType.None
member.summary: No Reference Trigger is configured.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerType.DigitalEdge
member.summary: The Reference Trigger is not asserted until a digital edge is detected. The source of the digital edge is specified using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerType.IQPowerEdge
member.summary: The Reference Trigger is asserted when the signal changes past the level specified by the slope (rising or falling), which is configured using the method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.RFmx.NRMX.RFmxNRMXTriggerType.Software
member.summary: The Reference Trigger is not asserted until a software trigger occurs.
